DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Substance Morphology T1 FLAIR Ratio Abnormality Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: T1/FLAIR ratio is a gross comparison in the overall lesion size between pre-contrast T1 and FLAIR (in the same plane).  Select T1~FLAIR when pre-contrast T1 abnormality (exclusive of signal intensity) approximates size of FLAIR abnormality; Select T1<FLAIR when the size of T1 abnormality is moderately smaller than the surrounding FLAIR envelope;  or select T1<<FLAIR when the size of the pre-contrast T1 abnormality is much smaller than size of FLAIR abnormality. (If no FLAIR images were provided select No FLAIR images).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lesion Substance Morphology T1 FLAIR Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The ratio of two or more signals of a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence which uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the the form and structure of abnormal tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A material with particular features.:Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.

Property.preferredName: Longitudinal Relaxation Time Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Ratio
Property.preferredDefinition: The time it takes for the net nuclear spin in the plane that is parallel to the magnetic field of a spectrometer to return to its equilibrium value.:A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.:The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE)

Concepts.definition: The time it takes for the net nuclear spin in the plane that is parallel to the magnetic field of a spectrometer to return to its equilibrium value.
A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
